data.title: Use pairing heap in pathfinding
data.body: whee, finally it's working, including the update (aka. decrease_key) operation!

data.title: Create benchmark function registering in buildsystem
data.body:
The buildsystem already supports `demo` and `test` for interactive and static execution of features.
`buildsystem/testing.cmake` needs to be extended to support a third category: `benchmark`.

This can (later?) be enhanced by an arbitrary amount of awesome features like plotting, uploading to a comparison server, regression testing etcetc.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/6429404-create-benchmark-function-registering-in-buildsystem?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F371436&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F371436&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Not listed build deps on Ubuntu 14.10
data.body:
I'm using a new install of Ubuntu 14.10 (not an upgrade from an older system). Before trying to build openage, I downloaded all dependencies listed in `building.md`.

While making the `media` target, python complained about missing `PIL` and `Numpy` modules missing. They are in the `python3-pil` and `python3-numpy` packages.

Could you add them to the `building.md` dependencies list ?

data.title: WIP - load and save maps for testing
data.body:
Pull my other branch first. This is currently being based off of that work.

some save (f5) and load (f9) map functions. It takes a while to setup a map with the right objects for testing so this just makes it easier. this is not a complete save and load -- units current state is dropped.
uses a filename "/tmp/saved_map.txt" to save and load.

data.title: opusfile.h missing at fedora 20
data.body:
With the given dependecies for fedora 20 it will not install the opus header file on the system. This results in the following error when ./configure is run:

```
CMake Error at /usr/share/cmake/Modules/FindPackageHandleStandardArgs.cmake:108 (message):
  Could NOT find Opusfile (missing: OPUSFILE_LIBRARY OPUSFILE_INCLUDE_DIR)
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  /usr/share/cmake/Modules/FindPackageHandleStandardArgs.cmake:315 (_FPHSA_FAILURE_MESSAGE)
  buildsystem/modules/FindOpusfile.cmake:27 (find_package_handle_standard_args)
  cpp/CMakeLists.txt:57 (find_package)
```

This can be solved by `yum install opusfile-devel`.

data.title: Implement job aborting to allow execution cancelation
data.body: While gamedata is being loaded, it's impossible to close the window without resorting to SIGKILL.  This is caused by the job manager waiting for all jobs to finish when `JobManager::stop()` is called.  The gamedata loading job should periodically check whether `JobManager::is_running` is set, so it can return or throw an exception if it finds it has been stopped prematurely.

data.title: Fix path.cpp compilation error in mac clang
reference system to stop segfault when gather target is removed
data.body:
Use a reference class instead of a pointer to a targeted object. there was no way to tell if the unit pointed at was deleted. If the target is removed from the game now, the reference can indicate this.

Added: 'p' key will draw unit paths. Many bugs with unit movement were fixed.

data.title: Font system: allow rendering centered and right alignments
data.body:
Currently only left-aligned rendering is possible...

data.title: Slowly implement game_main mess as sane engine features
data.body: The `Game` object should be initialized directly from `int main()`, with `--no-video` and `--no-audio` arguments.

data.title: Cache blending
data.body: Blending data is now cached, implements issue #154.

data.title: Added gperftools profiler, buildsystem options, some utilities
data.body:
Should be all good for merging. Needs testing on Mac OS, though.

Spot the difference:
![openage_2014-11-15_07-33-47_00](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/796624/5056785/cfe08bd2-6c99-11e4-85ab-548ec1768b08.png)

data.title: Visualize pathfinding
data.body: To improve the search and find errors, the pathfinding algorithm results should be drawn in the game.

data.title: convert: split up game specification code generation
data.body: This just separates all the code and data generation components into more files. It's the first step for optimizing the gamespec conversion code.

data.title: Cache terrain blending results
data.body:
The terrain blending calculation should not be done on every frame, results can be buffered perfectly and only updates can change the terrain overlays. The terrain blending calculation is done in `libopenage/terrain/terrain.cpp`.

This should greatly improve performance, to boost the speed and flexibility even more, a separate shader for this should be implemented (see #149).

data.title: WIP - Graphics renderer
data.body:
To discuss the current work - NOTE: This is probably quite an old version of the source by now. However, feedback on performance, would be good.

I have profiled this code and noticed most of the time is spent inside code calculating coordinates for terrain. Maybe this needs tuning? (or only calculating once?)

data.title: Fix warnings on 32 bit systems
data.body:
- Change format specifiers to not make assumptions about integer and
  size_t sizes
- Change audio hash function to shift a different amount based on
  sizeof(size_t)

data.title: Added block allocator
data.body:
I've written up a block allocator for single objects with cheap new/delete variants and pretty decent cache characteristics. It's been tested with the linked list and pairing heap. It was originally going to go with some pathfinding/unit stuff, but Jon0 wayyyyy beat me to that punch. Figured it could still be helpful though.

Also added a hash function for tiles and made some pointers into std::vectors in the terrain class.

data.title: Implement terrain blending in the shader
data.body:
The terrain blending should be updated to be processed in the shader directly instead of drawing and overlaying the tiles again and again.

When we activate the z-buffer, this overdrawing will no longer work (z-fighting yay).

The new plan is to meld all involved textures (blending masks and terrains) directly in one shader.
This generates just one drawable which is then compatible to z-buffering.

data.title: Wrong tile blending.
data.body: This is a well known issue, if you place a grass tile between two water tiles the grass tile doesn't blend correctly.

data.title: Look for sound files in both sounds.drs and sounds_x1.drs folders
Minor fixes
data.body: Change the name of the assets from `userassets` to `assets` and add the `-d` option which was mentionned in the help

data.title: codegen: improve unknown enum value error message
data.body:
In order to prevent further issues due to changes like #119 (see #144, [a comment on #69](https://github.com/SFTtech/openage/pull/69#issuecomment-61998049)) this improves the error message when an unknown enum value has been encountered. 

It simply suggests to `make media` :)

new error message:

```
    FATAL Exception: unknown enum value 'OLD_IDENTIFIER' encountered. valid are: TERRAIN,SHADOW,RUBBLE,UNIT_LOW,FISH,CRATER,UNIT,BLACKSMITH,BIRD,PROJECTILE
    ---
    If this is an inconsistency due to updates in the media converter, `make media` should fix it
    ---
```

data.title: Game exits with exception "unknown enum value RESSOURCES"
data.body:
After a git pull, and make clean, configure, make, and ./openage I got this:

MSG   ERROR: unknown enum value 'RESSOURCES' encountered. valid are: RESOURCES,TREES,NEARBY_UNITS,TARGET_ONLY
FATAL Exception: unknown enum value 'RESSOURCES' encountered. valid are: RESOURCES,TREES,NEARBY_UNITS,TARGET_ONLY

data.title: coord: divide negatives as supposed, make rendering pixel perfect
data.body:
I SPENT TWO HOURS ON FIGURING HOW TO FIX THIS!
I'm really tired so here is an explanation: 
http://www.microhowto.info/howto/round_towards_minus_infinity_when_dividing_integers_in_c_or_c++.html

This caused that the 4 "quadrants" of the rendering were misaligned. Not good for perfectionists (?)

This bug went unnoticed until put some solid lines on the tile borders. Also when the game starts it's fine, it breaks when you move the camera. 

---

demo pictures look at them in 1:1 because pixels and look in the center, vertical horizontal lines

before:
![openage_2014-11-07_04-19-02_00](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/726447/4949673/90f9024c-664e-11e4-85e0-25cbbf7fa8c2.png)

after:
![openage_2014-11-07_04-18-27_00](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/726447/4949675/961656b2-664e-11e4-952b-b08e4afedf47.png)

data.title: Terrain tiles perspective merging
data.body:
Let's say i have the following terrain texture made by A Bad Guy (notice the colour dots in the alpha space)
![15001 slp](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/726447/4948913/efaef48a-6627-11e4-9748-1fe34d8216e6.png)

The alpha space is outside the rhombus, so it'd be okay... [_right?_](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YztLZ_NfgdQ)

![1415339142](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/726447/4948925/367f1084-6628-11e4-9735-706f281df0ad.png)

NOPE! THE DOTS TRY TO REACH GABEN!

Basically each tile wastes half the space.

We should fix this :grinning:

data.title: move screenshot and blending toggle from keydown to keyup
data.body:
Both F1 and F3 are handled on KEYUP.
Toggling blending and screenshots are handled to KEYDOWN: this makes them susceptible to "the holding thing", in which holding a key makes the KEYDOWN event fire repeatedly.

This fixes that "holding thing" moving those keybindings to KEYUP, which also makes the code tidier :dancer: 

Supersedes #139

data.title: take screens on F2 release, not on press or hold
data.body:
Both F1 and F3 are handled on KEYUP.

Screenshot should be handled on KEYUP too: not only it makes the code tidier,  this also prevents taking repeated screenshots if SDL decides the key has hit the "hold" delay and reraises the KEYDOWN event.
